Class SettingsController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controllers.SettingsController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class SettingsController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller for the Settings Screen of the application.

This class handles the following in the Settings Menu:

  • Load the saved Settings
  • Display the saved Settings
  • Change the saved setting through SaveData

This controller is loaded when the Settings Menu is called

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the Setting screen.

      This method will:

      • Loads saved volume settings
      • Set up the buttons and slider
      • Loads and displays keyboard shortcuts
      • Saves changes made by the player
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - unused but required by Initializable
      resourceBundle - unused but required by Initializable

    • openSettings

      public static javafx.scene.Parent openSettings(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane rootPane)
      Opens the Settings menu and adds it on top of the current UI.

      The method loads the FXML layout for the settings menu using FXMLLoader and adds it to the provided rootPane. The new settings pane overlays the existing UI components.

      Parameters:
      rootPane - the root container of the current scene to which the settings pane will be added
      Returns:
      the loaded Parent node representing the settings pane
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the FXML file cannot be loaded

    • closeSettings

      public void closeSettings()
      Closes the Settings Menu when the user clicks on the close button

    • setRootPane

      public void setRootPane(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane rootPane)
      Sets up the Root Pane so the Settings Menu can stack on top of other FXML

    • setSettingsPane

      public void setSettingsPane(javafx.scene.Parent settingsPane)
      Sets up the settings Pane
